summary: The Rural Emergency Hospital Financial Stability Act (H.R. 4277) amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to clarify Medicaid payment for rural emergency hospitals. The bill treats these hospitals as outpatient facilities for Medicaid purposes.  It specifies that services provided in a nursing facility that is a distinct part unit of a rural emergency hospital are included. The amendments would take effect upon enactment, and the Secretary of Health and Human Services is mandated to issue final regulations within 12 months.
